title-group.article-title: PROBABILISTIC DISCREPANCY BOUND FOR MONTE CARLO POINT SETS

abstract.p: By a profound result of Heinrich, Novak, Wasilkowski, and Woźniakowski the inverse of the star-discrepancy n*(s,e) satisfies the upper bound n*(s,ε) ≤ cabssε⁻². This is equivalent to the fact that for any N and s there exists a set of N points in [0, 1]s whose star-discrepancy is bounded by cabss1/2N-1/2. The proof is based on the observation that a random point set satisfies the desired discrepancy bound with positive probability. In the present paper we prove an applied version of this result, making it applicable for computational purposes: for any given number q ∈ (0,1) there exists an (explicitly stated) number c(q) such that the star-discrepancy of a random set of N points in [0,1]s is bounded by c(q)s1/2N-1/2 with probability at least q, uniformly in N and s.
